24-25-11-communication11.title: Employees with paper pay cheques impacted by the Canada Post labour disruption
24-25-11-communication11.what:
• In response to the Canada Post labour disruption, Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) has put in place a temporary measure for federal government employees that receive a paper pay cheque.
  • PSPC will hold paper pay cheques for affected employees over the course of the Canada Post labour disruption. All paper pay cheques will be delivered following the end of the labour disruption, once mail services resume.
  • In the interim, affected employees are encouraged to enroll in direct deposit to minimize the impact of the current disruption to mail services.
  • In addition, employees that choose to enroll in direct deposit during the labour disruption can request to have a duplicate payment issued by direct deposit to replace a payment issued as a paper cheque (see the Notes section for further details).
24-25-11-communication11.resources:
• Find out how employees can add or change their Direct deposit information in the pay system.
  • Search for forms in the catalogue inventory to find the PWGSC-TPSGC 8437 direct deposit enrollment request form and the PWGSC-TPSGC 535 undertaking and indemnity (for cheques issued by the Receiver General) form.
  • Employees whose department or agency is served by the Pay Centre can reach out to the Pay and Benefits Client Contact Centre to get assistance and to submit the forms necessary to issue a duplicate payment.
  • Departmental CAs (not served by the Pay Centre) can reach out to the Ottawa Pay Support team to submit the forms necessary to issue a duplicate payment for their employee. CAs must indicate clearly in their email the subject line “Request for duplicate payment – Canada Post labour dispute” and in the body “Request to issue a duplicate payment by direct deposit because the regular paper pay cheque was not received due to the Canada Post labour dispute.

  • Employees in this scenario will not have 2 years of continuous participation in the SDB plan. Therefore, the 10% coverage reduction beginning at age 66 would occur before the cost reduction for the $10,000 paid up coverage.   • In these cases, the CA must ensure that the same coverage begin date entered for plan type 26 (Supplemental Death Benefit) on the employee side is also entered on the employer side for plan type 2T (Supplemental Death ben ER paid).

24-07-05-communication48.title: New statutory deduction codes for Canada Pension Plan and Québec Pension Plan contributions
24-07-05-communication48.what:
• Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) would like to remind you of the enhancements made to the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) and the Québec Pension Plan (QPP) that came into effect in 2024. Deductions for contributions to the second additional component of these plans will display under a new code on the employee’s paycheque.

  • To account for the higher contribution rate and earnings limit that was introduced by the second additional component for both plans, PSPC has added new statutory deduction codes to the pay system for CPP and QPP (for employees working in Québec):

    • CP2 – CPP second additional employee contributions, or
    • QP2 – QPP second additional employee contributions.

  • Once employees reach the annual earnings limit for the first component, deductions for CPP and QPP contributions will stop under codes CPP and QPP. Thereafter, deductions will start under codes CP2 and QP2 and continue until employees reach the annual earnings limit for the second component. More information on rates and limits can be found on Canada.ca or retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca (see resources section for links).
24-07-05-communication48.resources:
• CAs can refer to the modifications applied to the Phoenix pay system for more information on Change Request (CR) 12595 released on February 24, 2024.

  • More information on the enhancements made to the CPP and QPP, including rates and earnings limits, can be found on the following webpages:

    • Canada Pension Plan (CPP) and the CPP enhancement
    • Enhancement of the Québec Pension Plan
    • Second additional CPP contribution (CPP2) rates and maximums

24-11-04-communication52.title: New codes for uncollectible debts to the Crown
24-11-04-communication52.what:
